Pakar LIPI Sebut Persoalan Utama Pendidikan adalah Kurikulum
07 Nov 2019, 09:26 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Peneliti LIPI Anggi Afriansyah menyatakan bahwa persoalan utama pendidikan di Indonesia adalah kurikulum. Anggi mengaku sepakat dengan Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Nadiem Makarin yang ingin merombak kurikulum pendidikan.
"Persoalan utama di pendidikan itu adalah tentang rumitnya kurikulum. Kalau bicara pendidikan, Indonesia mengalami perubahan berulang mengenai kurikulum, ada KTSP sampai sekarang Kurikulum 13," ujar Anggi kepada Tempo melalui sambungan telepon, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Sebelumnya, Nadiem diminta oleh Presiden Jokowi agar reformasi besar-besaran dilakukan di lingkup Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan.
“Saya juga minta agar kita semuanya mendukung reformasi besar-besaran di Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan dan juga di Kemenag,” kata Presiden Jokowi dalam rapat terbatas Penyampaian Program dan Kegiatan di Bidang Pembangunan Manusia dan Kebudayaan di Kantor Presiden Jakarta, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Anggi mengatakan, kurikulum di Indonesia tidak memperhatikan kualitas kondisi sosial dan keberagaman di Indonesia.
"Padahal itu amanat UU Sisdiknas yang harusnya berprinsip tidak diskriminatif. Tapi kenyataan tidak ada penerapan seperti itu," tutur Anggi.
Kemudian, Anggi melanjutkan, kondisi guru juga tidak sepenuhnya mendidik peserta didik, karena dibebankan untuk membuat Rencana Pelaksanaan Pembelajaran (RPP). "Jadi mau mengajar membuat RPP dulu, padahal ketika mengajar, RPP-nya tidak digunakan semuanya. Jadi tidak hanya bicara satu sisi saja," kata Anggi.
Menurut Anggi Mendikbud tidak bisa membangun pendidikan sendiri, tapi harus bekerja sama dengan Pemda. Kurukulim itu masuk di Undang-Undang Nomor 20 Tahun 2003 tentang Sistem Pendidikan Nasional (SISDIKNAS) khususnya Bab X tentang Kurikulum pasal 36, 37, dan 38. "Harus juga bekerja sama dengan Pemda yang punya wewenang juga mengenai infrastruktur," lanjutnya.
Anggi berharap Nadiem bisa membawa sesuatu yang baru di Indonesia. "Karena merombak kurikulum adalah terobosan dari presiden. Dan Nadiem kan bukan orang yang berasal dari ekosistem pendidikan, tapi diharapkan membawa hal baru, tapi kembali lagi bahwa Indonesia itu beragam, sehingga harus melihat aspek keberagaman itu," kata Anggi.
Dan yang terpenting, Anggi berujar, jangan sampai terjebak dengan pola pikir mengenai pendidikan yang siap menciptakan peserta didik untuk kerja, tapi harus diperhatikan juga dari segi sosial impact-nya.

LIPI Experts Call The Main Issue of Education is the Curriculum
Nov 7 2019, 09:26 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - LIPI researcher Anggi Afriansyah stated that the main problem for education in Indonesia is the curriculum. Anggi said he agreed with the Minister of Education and Culture Nadiem Makarin who wanted to overhaul the education curriculum.
"The main problem in education is about the complexity of the curriculum. When it comes to education, Indonesia has experienced repeated changes regarding the curriculum, there is a KTSP up to now Curriculum 13," Anggi told Tempo by telephone, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Earlier, Nadiem was asked by President Jokowi that major reforms be carried out within the Ministry of Education and Culture.
"I also ask that we all support massive reforms in the Ministry of Education and Culture and also in the Ministry of Religion," said President Jokowi in a limited meeting to Deliver Programs and Activities in the Field of Human Development and Culture in the Office of the President of Jakarta, Thursday, 31 October 2019.
Anggi said, the curriculum in Indonesia did not pay attention to the quality of social conditions and diversity in Indonesia.
"Even though it is mandated by the National Education System Law which should not be discriminatory in principle. But in reality there is no such application," Anggi said.
Then, Anggi continued, the condition of the teacher also did not fully educate students, because it was charged to make a Learning Implementation Plan (RPP). "So we want to teach to make lesson plans first, whereas when teaching, lesson plans are not used all of them. So don't just talk one side only," Anggi said.
According to Anggi, the Minister of Education and Culture cannot build his own education, but must cooperate with the Regional Government. The Kurukulim is included in Law Number 20 Year 2003 concerning the National Education System (SISDIKNAS) especially Chapter X on Curriculum articles 36, 37 and 38. "Must also cooperate with local governments that have authority also regarding infrastructure," he continued.
Anggi hopes that Nadiem can bring something new in Indonesia. "Because overhauling the curriculum is a breakthrough from the president. And Nadiem is not a person who comes from the education ecosystem, but is expected to bring new things, but again that Indonesia is diverse, so it must look at aspects of diversity," said Anggi.
And most importantly, Anggi said, do not get stuck with the mindset about education that is ready to create students for work, but it must also be considered in terms of its social impact.
